page.title: 18CHURCHES
page.content: There are two churches in our area. (This only includes churches which are part of the{Anglican communion}.) {All Saints}in Huntingdon is positioned by the market square. It has a tower with bells, three altars, a font, an organ, choir stalls and a vestry. {St. Mary Magdelene}is positioned on a triangulation point on a high spot in Brampton.It has a tower with six working bells, a Lady Chapel(dedicated to Lady Olivier Bernard Sparrow), two altars, a vestry, an affiliated choir, choir stalls, an organ(with unpainted pipes and three manuals), a 15th Century Rood Screen and loft, a Norman Font(with replica Jacobean cover) and the vaults of the{Montagu}family(the Earls of Sandwich.)
